ygData.subject: RE: [archive-crawler] How to bring Heritrix latest src in Eclipse
ygData.msgSnippet: The .classpath and .project files are not included in the source archives. If you have Subclipse installed on your box I recommend just using it to checkout

The .classpath and .project files are not included in the source
archives. =
If you have Subclipse installed on your box I recommend just
using it to ch=
eckout the branch/tag (can't remember which): then things
"just work". It's=
 really quite nice.
 
    -tree

The eclipse dot files must not be bundled into the src tarball. 
Downl=
oad them individually here from the heritrix_1_12 src branch -- 
https://ar=
chive-crawler.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/archive-crawler/bran
ches/heritri=
x_1_12/

nches/heritrix_1_12/>  
-- and put them manually into your unbundled =
src (or checkout the
branch).
St.Ack

mjjjhjemj wrote:
>
> I have downloade=
d the latest Heritrix source from Sourceforge -
> 1.12.1. It mentions in th=
e manual somewhere that the .project and
> .classpath files are included in=
 the top directory.
>
> A full search in the directories and all that I fin=
d are:
> project.xml and project.properties
>
> I am new to Eclipse and a j=
ava IDE and hope to some guidance on how to
> get started with the latest s=
ource in Eclipse. I am interested in
> making some changes to MirrorWriter =
and compiling the build and
> running tests on the changes.
>
> Thanks for =
any help,
> Mike
